    • Method Detail

      • createRequests4Operator

        public static SwimRequestBean createRequests4Operator(DAO sql,
                                                      ILogger logger,
                                                      EventOutBean eventOut,
                                                      java.lang.String requestNote,
                                                      java.lang.String systemUserCode,
                                                      java.util.Properties properties)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        This action can be used in EVENT_OUT/BEFORE flow. It generate an ARM request for each operation related to accounts with manual fulfillment. In case of events generated by an ARM process, this action just create the sub-request for the EXE step (i.e. for the Operator) linked to the existing ARM request. In case of events generated by other modules (system events) it also create a DUMMY parent request. WARNING: the dummy request is created for the following out of the box processes - Account_Change - ChangePassword - Access_Request - Insert Account - Modify Account To override the process names use the parameter "properties".
        Parameters:
        sql -
        logger -
        eventOut -
        requestNote: - If null requestNote= If emptyString, no notes added
        systemUserCode: - UserID of the Applicant for the DUMMY request. This user must exist in IGI. If null systemUserCode="System"
        properties: - used to override the process names. Use the key: "system.process." where is the numeric code of the current event. If this parameter is null the action uses the default process names. can be: 1=permission add, 2=permission remove, 6=lock, 7=unlock, 11=reset password, 8=Create Account, 9=Remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
